intro: Myosotis hamosa, commonly known as the blue-eyed Mary, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its small, delicate blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers bloom in clusters at the top of the stems. Myosotis hamosa is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional Māori medicine.
